head.supplied: Melbourne bot, Garden ¶ 27/1/64 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that I may be permitted to present on behalf of the Victorian Government one copy of the still remaining ones of the Flora Austr...

div.p: E64/973, unit 24, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that I may be permitted to present on behalf of the Victorian Government one copy of the still remaining ones of the Flora Australiensis to His Excellency Sir Will. Denison, the Acting Governor General of India, for acknowledging by this reciprocate the kindness of sending to us Capt Beddomes valuable work on Ferns.

I beg also to submit a requisition for your kind consideration for a copy of my own works to be sent to the botanical Society of France & an other copy intended for G. Elph. Dalrymple Esq who has rendered most important services, involving considerable expense, to Mr Dallachy in his capacity as collector of the botanic Garden in the unsettled districts of Queensland. Perhaps I may be allowed to add also a copy of the flora Australiensis for the latter Gentleman

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p:
&c &c &c
Approval for M's request was minuted to his letter and it forwarded to the Government Printer.
